data.title: Show the texture name after the frame number in the SpriteFrames editor
data.body: Fixes #3112

data.title: Borderless windows
data.body: Adds borderless window support to the Windows build of the engine. Also centers the window by default.

data.title: New 'get_stream_metadata' method for vorbis stream class.
data.body: Attempts to return ogg metadata as a dictionary. The purpose of this is to be used for an ingame music player which allows users to import their own soundtrack.

data.title: Can't compile without tools
data.body:
There's an error when compiling the current HEAD without tools enabled. It was introduced in 2db78e8f.

Error message:

```
scene/main/scene_main_loop.cpp:624:24: error: use of undeclared identifier 'edited_scene_root'
        return editor_hint && edited_scene_root && edited_scene_root->is_a_parent_of(p_node);
                              ^
```

`edited_scene_root` is only there if `TOOLS_ENABLED` is defined

data.title: exported binaries don't run
data.body:
Hi I compiled godot from source code and I'm trying to export the 2d platformer demo.
I'm using fedora 23.
So I export the binary and when I run it:

```
/home/adam/godot: /lib64/libssl.so.1.0.0: no version information available (required by /home/adam/godot)
/home/adam/godot: /lib64/libcrypto.so.1.0.0: no version information available (required by /home/adam/godot)
BOOT SPLASH:
BOOT SPLASH IS : 
ERROR: set_code_buffer: Condition ' version>5 ' is true. returned: ERR_INVALID_DATA
   At: modules/gdscript/gd_tokenizer.cpp:1061.
ERROR: operator[]: Condition ' p_index<0 || p_index>=size() ' is true. returned: aux
   At: core/vector.h:128.
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

you probably shouldn't worry about the first two lines (the ones that require libssl and stuff, I kind of handled it) I believe it's the part that comes after `BOOT SPLASH IS:`

data.title: Fix delay on audio stream pause
data.body: Self-explanatory: when pausing before, there would be a delay until the stream actually paused properly.

data.title: send axis events only once per frame on linux
data.body: fixes a massive performance hit for gamepads with high sensitivity sticks (before, a ds4 could cause 100% core load on my laptop)

data.title: Invalid Tile origin when set as Center
data.body:
You can recreate this bug with the Kinematic Collision demo:
- Set the TileMap's _Cell_->_Tile Origin_ property to _Center_.
- Select the tile and compare its preview origin to the added tiles origin.

You should see something like this:
![vs4itdo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/12076884/7926d25c-b1c0-11e5-88cb-e0a89bc3f29e.png)

The origin for the added tile is different than the preview's. I am not sure if the preview is the right one or if it should be like this:

![igg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/12076920/42f957fc-b1c2-11e5-94c1-d46c74432624.png)

data.title: You can now create an inherited scene based on an already opened scene
data.body: Fixes #3063

data.title: Error parsing engine.cfg with "." or ":" in a tag
data.body:
ConfgFile::load - /path/to/engine.cfg:30 error: Expected Identifier

This is caused by trying to load a config file with a '.' in a tag, like 'display.iOS'.  I have verified that removing the tag with a period in it does fix the error.

data.title: Bind Node.NOTIFICATION_INSTANCED constant
data.body: Properly resolves #2261.

data.title: Suggestion: Multiple Scripts
data.body:
I'm unsure if this has been discussed and dismissed, but I think this engine would benefit from allowing objects to run multiple scripts. As far as I am aware there is no feature for this but correct me if I am wrong.

I feel like this would be a very good way to separate functionality and keep devs from having to create scripts that might combine behaviour they have already written. Like for example, if you want an enemy that has the same AI as the basic enemy but needs some special functionality like enhanced AI for given scenarios, it might help to just add a smaller script containing the extended AI features rather than a longer script containing the basic AI mixed with the enhanced AI. This is not currently my issue and I do realize this problem can be solved by using Godot's current scripting solution, however I feel like this feature would help modulate scripts for better project management.

Let me know what you think,
thanks for reading.

data.title: Consider texture offset when rotating tiles
data.body: Fixes #3153

data.title: 3D Raycast not colliding with hidden bodies
data.body: Fairly self explanatory, as far as I know this is unintended.

data.title: raycast(3d) does not does not appear to be constant
data.body: I made a demo showcasing how to hide nodes obstructing your view utilizing raycasts. With no movement taking place, raycast will alternate between colliding and not colliding super fast. The project in the demo I'm linking will showcase this perfectly. https://github.com/oxrock/Godot-camera-raycasting-demo  By default, player.gd is loaded on the player node. That is my workaround attempt. Load player_OLD.gd on the player node for the pure spazzy experience.

data.title: Lower level Subscenes are not refreshed automatically in parent scenes
data.body:
This issue is fresh continuation of https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2307 topic. 

Current status:
- Issue it's partially addressed since changes on the first level seems to be refreshed in parent scenes automatically. 
- For lower level changes we still need to close and reopen parent scenes. 

_(I'm not 100% sure what milestone should be, for now setting 2.0 since this is milestone of original issue.)_

data.title: 3D Rigidbody never sleeps if bounce >= 0.39
data.body: When you create 3d RigidBody with bounce >= 0.39 then it will never sleep (below it sleeps correctly, default mass, sphere collider, with radius set to 0.2). I tested this in df5fa62ab955437f05bfd7acdf6ed61d6d9c827e commit but I have feeling that this bug is a lot more old.

data.title: Projects got lost in Projectlist.
data.body: Projects are not displayed in the project list anymore. Seems to be related with icon set in the engine.cfg

data.title: Error exporting on android in 2.0 Alpha
data.body:
I get this error and then it force close the app, it runs on pc just fine.
error opening cache file /data/data/org.godotengine.game/cache/com.android.opengl.shaders_cache: Permission denied (13)

data.title: VariantParser issue: layout and snap/grid settings not loaded on startup.
data.body:
Currently happening in  be1f2a0 , but the error started a couple days ago. The position of the inspector (which I usually move to the same space as filesystem to form two tabs and free space to the right) is reset every time the project is opened, where it will return to its default position at the right of the 2D/3D/Script editor components.

While only a minor near-cosmetic issue, it used to remember the setting before, so I assume something went wrong with the recent config file changes?

EDIT: It seems some other settings like snap/grid settings aren't getting saved either. Should this be renamed to a general config file thing?

data.title: Mouse grab error when modifying a slider/spinbox min/max values by dragging
data.body:
Since a few commits ago, and still existing in be1f2a0, trying to modify the value of certain editor spinboxes in the inspector by click-dragging mouse over the value, will do something weird with the mouse. Instead of modifying the value and releasing the mouse when the mouse button is released, it'll prematurely stop modifying the spinbox and the mouse will be released, but the cursor will remain hidden, and it will return to the position of the edited spinbox in regular intervals.

The only way to restore the mouse cursor in the editor is to close everything and reopen. This can be detrimental as undo buffers can be lost. Fortunately, the scene can still be saved and exited with the keyboard. Alt+tabbing out of the editor shows the mouse cursor again, but returning to the editor will hide it immediately.

I am not entirely sure, but seems it's more likely to happen when the spinbox has decimal values, with integer ones, at least the ones I use frequently, can be modified in this fashion with no issues.

System is Ubuntu 15.10 64b, KDE desktop (kwin 5). I haven't tried to reproduce in other OSs or windowing systems at the time, but if no one else can reproduce the issue it could be something to check.

data.title: TSCN format not keeping signal binds.
data.body:
Binds assigned to signals (rightmost panel, when connecting a new signal to a node) aren't preserved in the TSCN format by commit  be1f2a0

When creating one and saving the file (in TSCN) it will show as

```
[connection signal="pressed" from="SkillEdit/SkillLV1" to="." method="_on_SkillLV_pressed"binds= [ 0 ]]
```

Note there's no space in between the double quote and binds. Apparently, **a side effect of this is that the bind won't work.**
Trying to add the space manually will remove "binds = [ 0 ]" entirely when the file is loaded. Meaning that, overall, binds in signals cannot be used or saved by the TSCN format.

data.title: Custom draw function only updates when scene is re-opened
data.body:
I have a custom draw function on a node to draw a circle but it doesn't show in the editor properly unless I reopen the scene.

Here is my script which is attached to a `Node2D`. As you can see its nothing special. However I think this may be a bug I can't find anything on it.

```
tool
extends Node2D

export(float) var radius
export(Color) var color

func _process(delta):
    update()

func _ready():
    set_process(true)

func _draw():
    draw_circle(Vector2(), radius, color)
```

Possibly I am missing a line of code telling it to update in the editor? I'm at a loss at the moment and would appreciate any help. Thank you so much.

data.title: Forgot to add JOY_ANALOG bindings
data.body: Sorry ^^

data.title: Analog values for gamepad triggers, using axes 6 & 7.
data.body: Also threw some variables out of the joystick struct on linux.

data.title: Add keyboard shortcut to toggle "show hidden files" in FileDialog
data.body:
Keyboard shortcut to toggle "show hidden files" in file dialog: _Ctrl + H_

Added `bool Control::window_is_modal_on_top(Control* p_modal)` method to avoid handling the input in dialogs that are behind the one on top.

More shortcuts could be added later, like refresh or zoom thumbnails.

Note: Using this shortcut in _EditorFileDialog_ modifies _"file_dialog/show_hidden_files"_ property in the editor settings. However, doing so on _FileDialog_ does not (I didn't find a clean way to do it... Would `#ifdef TOOLS_ENABLED` do the job?).

data.title: Triggers on X-box controller no longer work
data.body:
I remember there was a PR with a proper controller mappings but probably since then analogue triggers stopped working on Windows. Making sure - analogue input can't be gathered, currently works only as a normal button. It's no longer on any axis 0-7 , used to be 3.
This is the commit #3101

data.title: Added default value param to ConfigFile.get_value()
data.body:
_ConfigFile.get_value(String section, String key)_ will allow passing an optional third parameter to specify the default value to be returned if the section or the section and key does not exist:

_ConfigFile.get_value(String section, String key, var default=NULL)_

Closes #2244

data.title: Improve PopupMenu API (index/ID)
data.body:
This issue is related to the topic discussed in #2861 about the PopupMenu API and the index/ID behaviour.

If there is going to be improvements related to this, it would probably be done for **3.0** as reduz and Akien mentioned (_"as it would likely break the API"_ compatibility).

I quote here what I think are the key parts of that discussion:

> ...
> 
> I still find a problem here though. Here is another example code:
> 
> ```
> menu.add_item("First", 0) # id 0
> menu.add_item("Second", 1) # id 1
> menu.add_item("Third") # id 0
> ```
> 
> Is it fine to have repeated IDs? With this code, if I press the element _**Third**_ in the menu, the following will happen:
> 
> ```
> func _menu_item_pressed(id):
>     var index = menu.get_item_index(id)
>     prints(index) # Prints 0
>     prints(menu.get_item_text(index)) # Prints First
> ```
> 
> -**neikeq**
# 

> ...
> 
> On the other hand that would be problematic:
> 
> ```
> menu.add_item("First", 2) # id 2
> menu.add_item("Second", 1) # id 1
> menu.add_item("Third") # id 2
> ```
> 
> I'm actually starting to wonder what this whole ID stuff is about. Why not use only indexes? If IDs are necessary, the code needs to be improved to prevent adding IDs that already exist...
> -**Akien**
# 

> ...
> 
> The reason we have custom ID is that it because it's pretty handy to add an enumerator constant as ID and then check it in a switch.
> -**reduz**
# 

> Hm... I find the behaviour as described in the documentation super confusing personally :)
> Even after @neikeq's fix, I guess it would still be possible to do:
> 
> ```
> menu.add_item("First") # index 0 and id 0
> menu.add_item("Second") # index 1 and id 1
> menu.add_item("Third", 0) # index 2 and id 0 !!
> ```
> 
> Maybe we could think of a better way to allow using enum constants as IDs without having this duality of the "id" argument?
> 
> ...
> -**Akien**
# 

> I think it might make more sense to use the `index` by default instead of `id`, i.e. `_menu_item_pressed(index):`, and provide a `get_item_id(index)` function.
> 
> `index` would therefore be guaranteed without duplicates, and it would still be possible to check an enum constant in a switch by using `get_item_id(index)`. Items without user-defined ID would get assigned -1 as ID.
> 
> WDYT?
> -**Akien**
# 

> Adding some more input from a discussion on IRC:
> 
> ```
> <reduz> Akien, neikeq: I think the righ behaviour should be to use ID if exists and otherwise emit with index
> <TheHX> but the fill mode of RichTextLabel don't seems to be working correctly
> <reduz> Akien, by default if you don't want ID, you can simply no use it
> <reduz> Akien, but yeah i just checked the code and it wasn't right, I changed it to actually emit index
> <Akien> reduz: The problem is that you might have IDs which are the same as indexes of elements without ID.
> <reduz> Akien, that is intended, IDs are more of a very handy feature when you work with enums so it's up to you to use them or not
> <Akien> reduz: The index is the only one that you can guarantee as unique IMO, so it's better to use it by default and make the ID accessible via another method
> <reduz> you can not use them and use metadata instead for referencing something
> <reduz> Akien, yes if you want to do it that way, then simply don't use IDs and use metadata to store an ID
> <Akien> reduz: No I mean use get_item_id instead of get_item_index as I proposed
> <Akien> It won't make ID less useful, you just need to use the function to get it instead of getting an "id" parameter that could be an id or an index, and you don't know which
> <reduz> Akien, i prefer not, as in most cases some people prefers to use enums and might forget to go the extra step to convert
> <Akien> Yeah but the current behaviour (at least the intended behaviour as described in the doc) is very confusing. You need to *know* how you defined your items to be able to parse them properly
> <Akien> But it's true that nobody complained so far ;)
> <reduz> Akien, maybe we acould be done is change the callbacks
> <reduz> Akien, have item_pressed and item_pressed_by_id
> <reduz> still though, can't do any compat breaking change until 3.0
> <reduz> if we change this, it will be in 3.0
> <Akien> reduz: Well 2.0 is not released yet, you can still break compat
> <Akien> People who use the alpha right now are aware that it's an alpha and can change
> <reduz> Akien, i prefer to wait, i have a long list of things to change that break compatibility that I prefer goes all at once
> <Akien> Alright :)
> <Akien> neikeq: WDYT?
> <reduz> it makes sense that you get index though, I would simply just do two signals: "item_pressed" and "id_pressed"
> <neikeq> well I agree with Akien. index makes more sense. currently you don't really know if you are receiving an id or an index
> <Akien> reduz, neikeq: Or just do as neikeq propose: pass two arguments. "item_pressed(index, custom_id)"
> <Akien> With custom_id being -1 for items without ID
> <Akien> This way people can use directly custom_id if they know that's what they want (they use enums), or index if they don't use enums, or both if they know they use both
> <Akien> (typically parse custom_id first, and in case it's -1, use index)
> <reduz> ok, makes sense, though i guess until 3.0 i prefer to not touch it
> ```
> 
> -**Akien**
